```{r}
# Poisson Distribution

x<- 0:10
plot(x,dpois(x,6.1), xlab="Number of Events in an Interval",ylab="P(X=x)",type="h")

plot(0:5,dpois(0:5,0.61), xlab="Number of Deaths in a Year",ylab="P(X=x)",type="h", main="Prussian Cavalary Men")

plot(0:5,ppois(0:5,0.61), xlab="Number of Events in an Interval",ylab="P(X<=x)",type="h", main="Prussian Cavalary Men",ylim=c(0,1))

plot(0:10,dpois(0:10,3.6), xlab="Number of Flaws",ylab="P(X=x)",type="h", main="Fibre Optic Flaws over 150m")


plot(0:300,dbinom(0:300,300,0.01), xlab="Number of Errors",ylab="P(X=k)",type="h", main="Number of Transmission Errors in 300")

plot(0:100,dbinom(0:100,100,0.05), xlab="Number of Errors",ylab="P(X=k)",type="h", main="Product Errors in 100")
plot(0:10,dbinom(0:10,100,0.05), xlab="Number of Errors",ylab="P(X=k)",type="h", main="Product Errors in 100")


plot(0:300,dpois(0:300,3), xlab="Number of Errors",ylab="P(X=x)",type="h", main="Number of Errors")


```
